About me

Software engineer with experience in Model-Based Testing in the automotive industry, focused on validation, verification, and software quality for complex systems.

Passionate about creating clean and responsive user interfaces using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Comfortable with modern build tools like Webpack and familiar with backend fundamentals, including Node.js and client–server communication.

Open to opportunities in both software and hardware, creating efficient and reliable solutions.

Work Experience

Software System Engineer

October 2023 - October 2024

Bertrandt Group

I worked as a Software System Engineer within the Model-Based Design (MBD) Academy, an activity focused on the development of software testing methods and tools for the automotive industry. The main responsibilities included the automation of software testing in Matlab/Simulink, the improvement of test case modeling methods in compliance with the ASIL D safety level, the optimization of testing processes, test execution and reporting, as well as defect management and tracking.

System Software Engineer Trainee

July 2023 - September 2024

Bertrandt Group

My activities within the MBD Academy included learning the V-Model process, gaining knowledge of AUTOSAR software architecture, introduction to the Automotive SPICE industry standard, and training in Matlab/Simulink model design.

Portfolio

The latest projects completed

This project is my first complex project from the Website Building module at Link Academy. It's a personal CV website built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Webpack. I used Bootstrap for responsive design and added visual effects with some libraries. I used Figma only for editing images and the logo.

Current features:

  • Smooth navigation
  • Scroll animations
  • Back to top button
  • Interactive image gallery
  • Responsive layout for all devices

Future features:

  • Translation to multiple languages
  • Dark mode

Live Demo

My CV

Website Building / Ongoing

This is a modern online flower shop website with a responsive design. The site uses Vite for fast development and Bootstrap for styling.

It includes animations with AOS when you scroll. There is also a dark mode toggle that users can switch on or off.

The website has the following sections: Home, About, Plans, Services, Portfolio, Testimonials, Contact.

The project is built with HTML templates and has a clean, professional look for selling flowers online.

Live Demo

Online Flowershop

Website Building / 24 March 2025

The Phonebook Application is a JavaScript-based web application that allows users to store, display, and manage contact information. The application enables users to save names along with their corresponding phone numbers and view them in an organized list.

The user interface is divided into two main sections:

  • A form for adding new contacts, which includes input fields for the contact's name and phone number, along with a submit button.
  • A list that displays all saved contacts in a clear and organized manner.

The Phonebook Application is implemented using React, with Vite used as the development and build tool.

Live Demo

Phonebook App

Application Development / 27 June 2025

This website presents a demo company through a modern and consistent design created in Figma.

The Home page includes the company name, a short description, and a representative visual, while the Products page displays offerings with images, titles, brief descriptions, and category navigation.

The Contact page provides a simple form and location information. All pages are connected through interactive prototyping and follow consistent design rules for colors, typography, and layout.

Live Demo

Web Design

Web Design / 06 April 2025

Canvas Clock is a web application developed using HTML5 Canvas API and JavaScript that displays an animated analog clock. The clock shows the current time by updating the position of the hour, minute, and second hands based on the system time.

The project uses basic 2D canvas drawing techniques and mathematical calculations to position elements correctly. It demonstrates fundamental concepts of real-time rendering and animation in web development.

Live Demo

Canvas Clock

Application Development / 24 July 2025

The project represents an animated circle created entirely with HTML and CSS, showcasing advanced techniques learned in the CSS module.

The animation uses linear gradients, CSS filters, CSS animations, 2D transformations, and pseudo-elements.

The glowing effect behind the animated circle follows its colors for a dynamic visual impact.

Live Demo

Circle Animation

CSS Animation / 12 February 2025
